name: LivINN Hotel Cincinnati North / Sharonville

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel last year at this same time and was looking forward to my return visit, until I saw the recent reviews. Since it was a PL stay, I was stuck, but ready to raise heck if needed.
reviews.title: Better experience than other reviewers
Last stay here for me!
reviews.text: I did not experience the assorted problems that the last few reviewers had.

reviews.title: Avoid the LivInn at all costs
reviews.text: - New carpet in rooms (even had the new carpet smell!)
The exterior of the Livinn Suites is nice. The lobby is modern and clean. The room we stayed in (on the 1st floor) was filthy.
reviews.title: Horrible - 7/21/07

reviews.text: When we arrived, we had to wait for the receptionist to finish her break. She was friendly and apologetic when she found out we were waiting.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Then our room smelled funny and the floors were sticky. Each room must only come with 2 small towels and a soap. Other family members staying there ended up finding an un-mentionable item floating in the toilet. When the receptionist was made aware, again she was apologetic and promised to let her manager know. She could not refund the room, as the room was not booked directly through the hotel. And she did not offer to switch the room.
reviews.title: Dirty Towels, Sticky Floors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, if you need a place to crash, and are not concerned with cleanliness, this hotel will do. However, we paid $92 and I feel it was worth around $40.00.
reviews.title: smelly room

reviews.text: We were in town for one night and needed a place to stay that was not too expensive, nor a dive either. I booked the hotel and then became worried after reading all the negative reviews. However, after staying there I would absolutely recommend this to someone else and would return if need be in the future. Our rooms (we had 3 of them) were clean and nice. There was a small fridge and microwave in the room along with a safe that was very convenient. The pool was nice with covered tent areas. The only negative I could say is the "continental breakfast" is only served from like 6am to 8 or 9am, which we missed. However, other than that I think it is a great room for the value!
reviews.title: Great deal
Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: I recommend this place. It was a great place to stay. The most important things for me are cleanliness, a pool, and a shopping center. It seemed liked LivInn Suites had everything I needed. My son loved to play in the pool for hours upon hours. My favorite breakfast is a homemade waffle. We could make our own waffles. Yum! I will be back.

reviews.title: Basic, value hotel, but not a 2.5 star
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel after a trip to Kings Island, only because we got it for a very reasonable price of $40 + tax from Hotwire. It was rated as 2.5 stars, but was definately not on par with Holiday Inn Express, more like a 2 star. The staff was not very helpful, could not even give us directions from Kings Island, or even tell us if the hotel was north or south of K.I. The room was fairly clean, no major complaints (and I am very picky), the complementary breakfast was the worst I've ever seen- waffles, cereal, bread and apples were it. There are a lot of nice restaurants and shopping right around the corner. Although I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again, it wasn't bad for $40 and I think most people would be satisfied with it, especially if you can get it for under $50.

reviews.title: A great Place!!
reviews.text: Fantastic! Spotless, affordable and offers more than higher priced chain hotels. They had high speed internet - WIRELESS! The pool, on site laundry and the free use of the computer rooms were great! They staff was so nice. I was sick one night and the manager went to the drug store and bought me cold medicine! They went out of their way to not only make me feel at home, but not to want to leave. I will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got there we had to wait for the receptionist to get off a personal call. Then she tried to put us in a smaller room than what we booked, but she was very nice about correcting the problem. Apparently there is no "King Studio-Premium". We got to our room and it was much smaller than expected. When I called down to get more pillows I was told I had to go to the front desk to pick them up. At the time I was 7 months pregnant. They didn't clean our room while we were. I had to go down to the front desk for more towels. Then to top it all off the elevator stunk to high heaven. I would never stay at this hotel again. There was no service provided other than shelter.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

reviews.text: We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay and found the Live Inn for about $60 per night. We were a little leary but decided to take the risk.
reviews.title: Much Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasanly surprised to say the least. Small problem with check in. They sent us to a room with someone already in it. Luckily the key didn't work and I could hear people inside so we didn't disturb them. Got that straightened up fairly quickly.
reviews.title: Short Stay, Great Value

likes.disliked: — Lack of indoor pool, hot tub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with 2 double beds, as we were traveling with 2 kids. The room was clean, but a little on the small side. Nice armoire for storing clothes in. Microwave and fridge in room was nice. They only gave a 2 towels for a room with 4 people, which was annoying but a quick trip to the front desk got us 2 more towels.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Cont Breakfast was fine for it's purpose. I agree that more fresh fruit or yogurt would be a nice addition.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

description: The LivINN Hotel Sharonville is considered Cincinnati's Best Value Hotel by offering more services and amenities than any other hotel in its price range. All rooms are interior corridor and include custom furnishings, free high speed internet, microwaves, refrigerators, coffee makers, hair dryers, irons and ironing boards. Studio Suites offer cooktops and wet bars and can also be rented on a weekly basis. An onsite outdoor pool and exercise room are also available. The hotel has meeting facilities that accommodate up to 50 persons and free use of computers rooms with printers to check email, complete business and print presentations.
